bill_title: prohibit the maintenance and operation of certain boot camp programs and to develop a plan for the potential uses of the boot camp facilities.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the maintenance and operation of certain boot camp programs and to develop a plan for the potential uses of the boot camp facilities. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 26-11A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: On and after December 31, 2002, neither the Department of Corrections nor any other state or local agency may operate any boot camp or other correctional program that: (1) Has military drill and ceremony as a component; (2) Accepts offenders under the age of eighteen; and (3) Requires offenders to participate in a rigorous daily schedule of hard labor or physical training. Section 2. The Department of Corrections shall develop a detailed plan for an alternative correctional program that emphasizes rehabilitation and education consistent with the Positive Peer Culture program. The plan shall include the use of the boot camp facilities located near Custer, South Dakota. The department shall make the plan available to the public and to all legislators by December 31, 2002.
